title: Borugula Upma | Uggani |Puffed Rice Upma| Breakfast
content:
South Indian Breakfast Recipe: Borugula Upma Servings: 3 Duration: 20 mins Puffed rice Upma/ Borugula upma is a special breakfast in Rayalaseema region, Andhra Pradesh 🇮🇳 It is a staple food and relishing freshly homemade breakfast is healthy, this breakfast recipe can called in other names such as Uggani/ Murmura Upma it varies between region but the process is same you can frequently find as a breakfast in restaurants/ street food in these regions Cuddapah, kurnool, Anantapur, chitoor districts in Andhra Pradesh state. While serving it in these districts again varies, i throughly observed in kurnool it served with Mirchi Bajji, tastes awesome you can tryout in this way and the variation in cuddapah district it's served with Spicy Roasted Chickpea Powder/ podi. Both are different in taste, I hope you could try and experience the taste of this lovely breakfast from south India 🇮🇳 Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Puffed Rice/ Murmura/ Borugullu - 200 gms
  • Onion - 1 medium - finely chopped
  • Tomato - 1 medium - finely chopped
  • Dessicated / Shredded coconut - 3 tb sp
  • Green chillies - 5 - sliced
  • Tamarind pulp - 1 lemon size - Soaked in water & Squeezed
  • Salt - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Cilantro - 1/3 cup - washed and chopped
For tempering:
  • Mustard seeds - 1 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Urad Dal - 1 tb sp
  • Chana dal - 1 tb sp
  • Curry leaves - 8-10 leaves
  • Oil - 1/4 cup - 60 ml
Procedure: Pre-preparation: 
  • Wash Murmura/ Borugulu in large and wide bowl & soak them in fresh water ( repeat this step twice)
  • Next, check the puffed rice is soft & smooth by pressing it between two fingers.
  • If it is soft & smooth then squeeze water and take out Murmura/Borugulu in another bowl ( as shown in picture)
  • Now Murmura is ready to make for breakfast. This is the basic step
Process of making Borugula Upma:
  • Heat skillet pan/ deep fry pan over medium heat
  • Add oil and tempering.. Saute 1 mins
  • Next add green chillies and Onions
  • Saute 2 minutes or till they become translucent
  • Add turmeric powder, salt and tomatoes
  • Mix well and cover with lid
  • Cook 2 to 3 mins and add tamarind pulp, salt & desiccated coconut
  • Mix well and Murmura
  • Gradually mix and add chopped cilantro .. mix well and cover with lid
  • Reduce heat to low and cook 5 mins
  • Turn off heat and gently mix then serve this breakfast with Pappulu Podi
  • Happy Cooking 👩🏻‍🍳& Have a nice day ☀️
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices and salt as per taste
  • To enjoy the taste, best to serve immediately
  • Murmura comes in two ways.. one is Normal Murmura and other one lightly salted Murmura (as shown in picture) I used salted variety
  • I added green chillies and desiccated coconut as is but you can also blend them together in mixer if you are using fresh coconut & it tastes great
